On this post, I've tried to gather some historical recordings of the instrumental music produced in Brazil. The first recordings were made in 1902 (by PatÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡pio Silva, Banda da Casa Edison), the year the first recording company was founded in Brazil, Casa Edison, by Frederico Figner.

The tunes in this collection comprise the period between 1902 and 1940 ("Cinco Companheiros", by Pixinguinha). Since I couldn't determine the recording year of all tracks, I've decided to omit this information.

More info (only in Portuguese) can be found at Linha do Tempo da InvenÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â§ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â£o Musical and also on the marvellous collection of Instituto Moreira Sales.
